name: SAGE | REC - 001 | List Dimension(s) Restricted Data
description: When there is a function call, do action and other actions

extended_input_schema.hint: Send a copy of the message to Workato logs. Learn more
extended_input_schema.label: Send to Workato log service
extended_input_schema.name: user_logs_enabled

extended_input_schema.hint: Give this action you're building a descriptive name, e.g. Create customer, Get customer
extended_input_schema.label: Action name
extended_input_schema.name: action_name

extended_input_schema.hint: Provides the content for the request. Learn more
extended_input_schema.label: Operation element of XML request
extended_input_schema.name: operation_element

properties.label: Transaction
properties.hint: Specifies whether all the functions in the operation block represent a single transaction. When set to Yes, all of the functions are treated as a single transaction. If one function fails, all previously executed functions within the operation are rolled back. This is useful for groups of functions that rely on each other to change information in the database. When set to No, which is the default, functions execute independently. If one function fails, others still proceed.

toggle_field.name: transaction
toggle_field.label: Transaction
toggle_field.hint: Specifies whether all the functions in the operation block represent a single transaction. When set to true, all of the functions are treated as a single transaction. If one function fails, all previously executed functions within the operation are rolled back. This is useful for groups of functions that rely on each other to change information in the database. When set to false, which is the default, functions execute independently. If one function fails, others still proceed.

properties.name: transaction

properties.label: Content part of XML request
properties.hint: Supplies one or more function elements to be executed. Provide a valid XML with <content>...</content> tag to send with the request. Learn more
properties.default:
<content>
      <!-- Search call sample -->
      <function controlid="UUID-1">
        <readByQuery>
          <object>LOCATION</object>
          <fields>*</fields>
          <query></query>
          <pagesize>2</pagesize>
          <returnFormat>xml</returnFormat>
        </readByQuery>
      </function>

      <!-- Create call sample -->
      <!--
      <function controlid="UUID-2">
        <create>
           <LOCATION>
             <LOCATIONID>23</LOCATIONID>
             <NAME>HQ</NAME>
           </LOCATION>
        </create>
      </function>
      -->
    </content>
properties.name: content_data

extended_input_schema.hint: Control element includes your Web Services credentials and applies to the entire request. Learn more
extended_input_schema.label: Control element of XML request
extended_input_schema.name: control_element

properties.label: Control ID
properties.hint: Control ID for request as a whole.
properties.name: controlid

properties.label: Unique ID
properties.hint: Used in conjuction with "Control ID". Specifies whether a request can be submitted more than once without an error.When set to Yes, which is the default, a request cannot be repeated. The "Control ID" attribute of the <function> element will be checked to determine if the operation was previously executed and completed. When set to No, the system allows the operation to execute any number of times.

toggle_field.name: uniqueid
toggle_field.label: Unique ID
toggle_field.hint: Used in conjuction with "Control ID". Specifies whether a request can be submitted more than once without an error.When set to true, which is the default, a request cannot be repeated. The "Control ID" attribute of the <function> element will be checked to determine if the operation was previously executed and completed. When set to false, the system allows the operation to execute any number of times.

properties.name: uniqueid

properties.label: DTD version
properties.hint: Identifies the version of the API in use. The value of 3.0 (default) is strongly recommended as it provides access to both the generic functions and the object-specific functions.
properties.name: dtdversion

extended_input_schema.empty_list_text: The header 'x-intacct-xml-request' is sent as 'Content-Type' by default.
extended_input_schema.empty_list_title: Does this HTTP request require extra headers?
extended_input_schema.label: Request headers
extended_input_schema.name: request_headers

extended_input_schema.hint: If Yes, the response returned with the failure status will be marked as an unsuccessful action, the error message is surfaced to the job report. If No, the response with failure status will be parsed and captured in the action output without raising any errors. This is useful for capturing the batch action (with multiple functions inside content tag) results.
extended_input_schema.label: Mark failure status in response as error?
extended_input_schema.name: surface_errors

toggle_field.name: surface_errors
toggle_field.label: Mark failure status in response as error?
toggle_field.hint: If yes, the response returned with the failure status will be marked as an unsuccessful action, the error message is surfaced to the job report. If no, the response with failure status will be parsed and captured in the action output without raising any errors. This is useful for capturing the batch action (with multiple functions inside content tag) results.

extended_input_schema.hint: If you are retrieving multiple locations using readByQuery, you can specify "location" as value. This mainly helps to parse the response XML and group the same tags as array. Provide comma-separated values for specifying multiple array tags.
extended_input_schema.label: Array tags in XML response
extended_input_schema.name: array_tags
